entry.title: Chinese characters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to legend, the invention of Chinese characters (examples pictured) caused grain to rain from the sky and ghosts and demons to wail in frustration?

entry.title: Alexandru Talex (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alexandru Talex was described as "the gentlest" member of a Romanian far-right organization?

entry.title: Atavista (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Human Sacrifice", a track on the 2024 album Atavista, could be heard in a 2019 Google Pixel advertisement?

entry.title: Jean Pettrequin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a mob in Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, detained Jean Pettrequin and searched for Sebastian Zouberbuhler because of a letter?

entry.title: ACS-1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although it was never built, Lynn Conway notes that IBM's ACS-1 would have been the premier supercomputer of the era?

entry.title: Caitlyn Wurzburger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that lacrosse player Caitlyn Wurzburger committed to a college program at the age of 14?

entry.title: Boom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while filming the Doctor Who episode "Boom" some takes lasted up to seven minutes?

entry.title: Mike Gorman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mike Gorman spent 43 consecutive years as the television play-by-play commentator for the Boston Celtics?

entry.title: Armenian Radio jokes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Armenian Radio jokes are neither about radio nor are they Armenian?
